plot contrasts

Source: R/tidyMS_R6Model.R
Contrasts_Plotter.Rd

plot contrasts

plot contrasts

Public fields

contrastDF

data frame with contrasts

modelName

name of model

subject_Id

hierarchy key columns

prefix

default Contrasts - used to generate file names column with fold change estimates

contrast

column with contrasts names, default "contrast"

figures

list of generated figures

figures_plotly

list of generated figures

volcano_spec

volcano plot specification

histogram_spec

plot specification

Methods

Public methods

  • Contrasts_Plotter$new()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$histogram()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$histogram_estimate()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$volcano()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$volcano_plotly()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$ma_plot()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$ma_plotly()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$write_pdf()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$write_plotly()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$get_minimal()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$to_wide()

  • Contrasts_Plotter$clone()

Method new()

create Crontrast_Plotter

Usage

Contrasts_Plotter$new(
  contrastDF,
  subject_Id,
  volcano = list(list(score = "p.value", fc = 1)),
  histogram = list(list(score = "p.value", xlim = c(0, 1, 0.05)), list(score =
    "p.value.adjusted", xlim = c(0, 1, 0.05))),
  modelName = "Model",
  estimate = "estimate",
  contrast = "contrast"
)

Arguments

contrastDF

frame with contrast data

subject_Id

columns containing subject Identifier

volcano

which score to plot and which ablines to add.

histogram

which scores to plot and which range (x) should be shown.

modelName

name of model

modelName

Model

estimate

estimate column

contrast

contrast column

Method histogram()

plot histogram of selected socres

Usage

Contrasts_Plotter$histogram()

Arguments

score

which scores to show - list of lists

Method histogram_estimate()

plot histogram of estimated fold change

Usage

Contrasts_Plotter$histogram_estimate()

plotly volcano plots

Usage

plotly volcano plots

Usage

for which scores to generate volcano plot

fold change abline

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples


rm(list = ls())
library(LFQService)
library(tidyverse)

D <- LFQService::ionstar$normalized()
D$data <- dplyr::filter(D$data ,protein_Id %in% sample(protein_Id, 100))
modelName <- "Model"
modelFunction <-
  make_custom_model_lmer("transformedIntensity  ~ dilution. + (1 | peptide_Id)",
   model_name = modelName)
pepIntensity <- D$data
config <- D$config
config$table$hkeysDepth()

#> [1] "protein_Id"
mod <- build_model(
 pepIntensity,
 modelFunction,
 modelName = modelName,
 subject_Id = config$table$hkeysDepth())

#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
#> Joining, by = "protein_Id"
 mod$get_coefficients()

#> # A tibble: 340 x 9
#> # Groups:   protein_Id [68]
#>    protein_Id isSingular nrcoef factor Estimate Std..Error     df t.value
#>    <chr>      <lgl>       <int> <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 sp|P21589~ FALSE           5 (Inte~  0.883       0.358   15.3   2.47  
#>  2 sp|P21589~ FALSE           5 dilut~  0.0975      0.0559 263.    1.74  
#>  3 sp|P21589~ FALSE           5 dilut~  0.0700      0.0557 263.    1.26  
#>  4 sp|P21589~ FALSE           5 dilut~ -0.0232      0.0564 263.   -0.412 
#>  5 sp|P21589~ FALSE           5 dilut~  0.127       0.0557 263.    2.27  
#>  6 sp|O43660~ FALSE           5 (Inte~ -1.15        0.200    8.14 -5.74  
#>  7 sp|O43660~ FALSE           5 dilut~  0.0266      0.119   75.1   0.223 
#>  8 sp|O43660~ FALSE           5 dilut~ -0.0128      0.125   75.2  -0.102 
#>  9 sp|O43660~ FALSE           5 dilut~  0.0302      0.123   75.2   0.245 
#> 10 sp|O43660~ FALSE           5 dilut~  0.00359     0.129   75.7   0.0277
#> # ... with 330 more rows, and 1 more variable: Pr...t.. <dbl>
 Contr <- c("dil.b_vs_a" = "dilution.b - dilution.a",
  "dil.e_vs_a" = "dilution.e - dilution.a",
  "dil.e_vs_b" = "dilution.e - dilution.b",
  "dil.c_vs_b" = "dilution.c - dilution.b"
 )
Contrasts$debug("get_contrasts")
contrast <- LFQService::Contrasts$new(mod$modelDF,
  Contr,
  modelFunction$contrast_fun,
  subject_Id = config$table$hkeysDepth(),
  modelName = modelFunction$modelName)
tmp <- contrast$get_contrasts()

#> debugging in: contrast$get_contrasts()
#> debug at C:/Users/wolski/prog/LFQService/R/tidyMS_R6Model.R#375: {
#>     linfct <- self$get_linfct()
#>     contrast_sides <- self$get_contrasts_sides()
#>     contrast_result <- contrasts_linfct(self$models, rbind(linfct$linfct, 
#>         linfct$linfct_A), subject_Id = self$subject_Id, contrastfun = self$contrastfun)
#>     contrast_result <- dplyr::rename(contrast_result, contrast = lhs)
#>     xx <- dplyr::select(contrast_result, self$subject_Id, "contrast", 
#>         "estimate")
#>     xx <- xx %>% pivot_wider(names_from = "contrast", values_from = "estimate")
#>     contrast_result <- dplyr::filter(contrast_result, contrast %in% 
#>         names(self$contrasts))
#>     get_contrast_cols <- function(i, contrast_results, contrast_table, 
#>         subject_ID) {
#>         data.frame(lhs = contrast_table[i, "contrast"], dplyr::select_at(contrast_results, 
#>             c(subject_ID, unlist(contrast_table[i, c("c1", "c2")]))), 
#>             c1_name = contrast_table[i, "c1", drop = T], c2_name = contrast_table[i, 
#>                 "c2", drop = T], stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
#>     }
#>     contrast_sides <- purrr::map_df(1:nrow(contrast_sides), get_contrast_cols, 
#>         xx, contrast_sides, self$subject_Id)
#>     contrast_result <- inner_join(contrast_sides, contrast_result)
#>     if (!all) {
#>         contrast_result <- contrast_result %>% select(-all_of(c("sigma.model", 
#>             "df.residual.model")))
#>     }
#>     contrast_result <- self$p.adjust(contrast_result, column = "p.value", 
#>         group_by_col = "contrast", newname = "FDR")
#>     return(contrast_result)
#> }
#> debug at C:/Users/wolski/prog/LFQService/R/tidyMS_R6Model.R#376: linfct <- self$get_linfct()

#>     "estimate")

#>     data.frame(lhs = contrast_table[i, "contrast"], dplyr::select_at(contrast_results, 
#>         c(subject_ID, unlist(contrast_table[i, c("c1", "c2")]))),

#>             "c2", drop = T], stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
#> }

#> debug at C:/Users/wolski/prog/LFQService/R/tidyMS_R6Model.R#407: contrast_result <- self$p.adjust(contrast_result, column = "p.value", 
#>     group_by_col = "contrast", newname = "FDR")
#> debug at C:/Users/wolski/prog/LFQService/R/tidyMS_R6Model.R#411: return(contrast_result)
#> exiting from: contrast$get_contrasts()
contrast$subject_Id

#> [1] "protein_Id"
cp <- Contrasts_Plotter$new(tmp , contrast$subject_Id)
cp$histogram()

#> Error in FUN(X[[i]], ...): object 'p.value.adjusted' not found
cp$histogram_estimate()

res <- cp$volcano()
length(res)

#> [1] 1
res

#> $p.value
#> 
respltly <- cp$volcano_plotly()

#> Warning: `group_by_()` is deprecated as of dplyr 0.7.0.
#> Please use `group_by()` instead.
#> See vignette('programming') for more help
#> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.
#> Call `lifecycle::last_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated.
length(respltly)

#> [1] 1
cp$ma_plot()

cp$ma_plotly()
cp$write_pdf("c:/Temp")

#> Writing: c:/Temp
cp$write_plotly("c:/Temp")

#> Writing: c:/Temp
#> Writing: c:/Temp/Contrasts_Volcano_Plolty_Model_p.value.html
#> Writing: c:/Temp/Contrasts_MA_Plolty_Model.html
bb <- cp$get_minimal()
bw <- cp$to_wide()
head(bw)
